job_title: Director of Community Outreach in Falmouth, MA
pros: We are saving lives every day! Great team Great benefits Job security Upward mobility
cons: The only downside has nothing to do with the company but more to do with the nature of the disease of addiction. If you are working in direct care, it can be challenging to watch people that continue to struggle so self-care is extremely important. There are many miracles every day but the ones who struggle can pull out your heart.

pros: Staff , mission people and friendliness

review_title: Amazing company saving lives and families.
job_title: Director of Marketing in Falmouth, MA
pros: I started at Gosnold in March 2020 as a contract employee. I am also an alumni of their programs. I was brought in at a very entry level and throughout the last two years have been awarded opportunities for full time employment and growth within the organization. I am deeply grateful for the opportunities for advancement that I have been given and the privilege to work for an organization that saved my life and so many others.
cons: My experience here as a patient and an employee has been remarkable.

job_title: Adult Learner in Falmouth, MA
pros: Ability to grow and develop new careers. Direct client care enables employees to watch clients recover from their addictions within the field.
cons:
Management appears to focus too much on COObeing somewhat as a "Superior Being."
Whenever Ray cane to the unit the Director always became tense and expected staff to be the same. Salaries were put on hold, so a new unit was built. Counselors had to come in on their unpaid time to do case notes, due of understaffing.

review_title: Most backwards place to work I’ve seen in my career
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Falmouth, MA
pros: Employees in trenches do good work with patients for the most part. I have to write this because there are no other pros but I need to write 20 words.
cons: Staff turnover. Staff burnout. Most clinicians aren’t licensed or trained in providing the care needed. Senior mgmt is playing at running a treatment center. They are beyond clueless. They eliminate the best personnel and hire surround themselves with untrained lackeys. They don’t know addiction or how to treat it
